html.p: A vector space over a field [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline] is, essentially, a (non-empty) set [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] in which one can do vector addition and scalar multiplication. For a more formal definition, see below.

div.h4: Formal Definition of a Vector Space

div.p: A vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] over a field [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline] is a set, together with an addition operation on [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] and a scalar multiplication of elements of [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline] on elements of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], that satisfies the following conditions:

li.p: Addition in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is associative and commutative; that is, for all [mathjaxinline]u,v,w \in V[/mathjaxinline], we have [mathjaxinline]u+(v+w) = (u+v)+w[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]u+v = v+u[/mathjaxinline].
There is an element [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{0}\in V[/mathjaxinline] such that [mathjaxinline]v+\mathbf{0}= v[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]v \in V[/mathjaxinline].
For every [mathjaxinline]v\in V[/mathjaxinline], there is an element [mathjaxinline]-v \in V[/mathjaxinline] such that [mathjaxinline]-v + v = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline].

Scalar multiplication distributes over addition; that is, for all [mathjaxinline]a \in F[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]u,v \in V[/mathjaxinline], , [mathjaxinline]a(u+v) = au + av[/mathjaxinline].
Scalar addition distributes as well; that is, for all [mathjaxinline]a,b \in F[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]v \in V[/mathjaxinline], , [mathjaxinline](a+b)v = av + bv[/mathjaxinline].
For all [mathjaxinline]a,b \in F[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]v\in V[/mathjaxinline], we have [mathjaxinline]a(bv) = (ab)v[/mathjaxinline].
